Entrance Fee (KZT / USD): PP 2000 KZT/USD 3,74 OW (bus) PP 4500 KZT/USD 8,41 OW (cable-car)
Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Panoramic city view, Beatles monument, TV tower, viewing platforms
Short Description (for website): Perched on a leafy hill above Almaty, Kök Töbe Hill offers panoramic views of the city and neighboring Tien Shan peaks. Visitors can go up via cable-car or vehicle, take a leisurely walk through the hilltop park, snap photos next to The Beatles monument and soak in some panoramic sunset. A convenient stopover from the city centre at half time for the day.
Seasonal Notes:
Cable-car operates year round but times can be affected by maintenance or high winds — check in advance.
Recommended warm clothing in winter – the altitude and wind makes it seem colder still.
Snow/Ice for the drive up Snow or ice on the drive can make it longer.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights:
Сolorful fruit & spice stalls
Sweet section with chak-chak and baursak
Bazaar entrance faсade (Zenkov St)
Short Description (for website): Traditional market known for local fruits, spices, meats, and authentic Almaty atmosphere.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Wooden Zenkov Cathedral (colorful facade), park alleys, WWII Memorial, Eternal Flame
Short Description (for website): One of Almaty’s most iconic landmarks — a peaceful park with the stunning Zenkov Cathedral, built entirely of wood without nails. Perfect for a calm walk and photos among tall trees.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Arbat murals, street artists, cozy cafés, fountain area
Short Description (for website): Lively pedestrian zone in central Almaty with shopping, street art, and local cafés.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Mosque courtyard, golden dome, mountain view backdrop
Short Description (for website): The largest mosque in Almaty, known for its blue domes and serene interior. A place of calm reflection and elegant Islamic architecture.

Attraction Name: Kazakh Museum of Folk Musical Instruments
Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Traditional dombras & kobyz instruments, wooden façade
Short Description (for website): Located in a charming wooden building in Panfilov Park, this museum showcases Kazakhstan’s traditional music and handcrafted instruments.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Independence Monument, fountains, government buildings
Short Description (for website): Central Almaty landmark symbolizing Kazakhstan’s independence, surrounded by fountains and city architecture — ideal for sunset photos.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Main façade, modern Kazakh art exhibits
Short Description (for website): The largest art museum in Kazakhstan, displaying national and international collections of paintings, sculpture, and decorative arts.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Ice rink with mountain backdrop, viewpoint terrace
Short Description (for website): Famous high-altitude ice rink surrounded by mountains, popular for skating and panoramic views of Almaty valley.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Cable car views, mountain slopes, cafés at top
Short Description (for website): Almaty’s premier ski resort with cable cars, restaurants, and scenic views year-round. Great for skiing, hiking, and dining above the clouds.

Entrance Fee (KZT / USD): Electro bike 25 000kzt/ 47,21 usd - free on walk
Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Turquoise lake, mountain reflections, photo terrace
Short Description (for website): Stunning alpine lake located in the mountains above Almaty — famous for its changing turquoise color and breathtaking scenery.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Natural pools, riverside rocks, forest views
Short Description (for website): Natural hot springs hidden in the mountains, offering outdoor relaxation with mineral waters and a peaceful forest setting.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Waterfall bridge, forest trail, photo viewpoint
Short Description (for website): Scenic mountain gorge with lush forests, trout farms, and the famous Bear Waterfall — perfect for day trips from Almaty.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Lake pier, viewpoint from hill, turquoise water shots
Short Description (for website): Beautiful mountain lake surrounded by pine forests, offering picnic areas and peaceful nature views near the ancient Issyk burial mounds.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Rock carvings; river backdrop
Short Description (for website): Ancient petroglyphs and rock inscriptions along the Ili River.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Red rock formations; Valley of Castles viewpoint
Short Description (for website): Dramatic red-rock canyon often visited on day trips from Almaty.
Seasonal Notes: Hot in summer; bring sun protection and water.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Alpine lakes; submerged forests; pine scenery
Short Description (for website): Series of stunning alpine lakes with walking trails and camping.
Seasonal Notes: Roads long; best late spring–early autumn.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Village streets; guesthouse fronts
Short Description (for website): Small mountain village serving as the gateway to Kolsai and Kaindy lakes.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Wide plateau views; nomadic camps
Short Description (for website): High-altitude plateau with panoramic views and nomadic culture experiences.
Seasonal Notes: Windy and cold outside summer months.

Top Photo Spots / Highlights: Singing Dune; Aktau rocks; kulan sightings
Short Description (for website): Protected park with unique landscapes including singing dunes and ancient petroglyphs.  Then there are two directions you can go: (1) Aktau mountain (75km one way), or (2) Singing Dune (50km one way). For the first one you need 4x4 car, crossover (like Hyundai Tucson) is ok, no need for car like Land Cruiser. After rain the road might get a bit challenging, so if the rain was in the night you might leave the first route for the afternoon to let the ground dry a bit. Second route is more accessible, given good weather conditions (no heavy rains) it is feasible to make it with city car.
Seasonal Notes: Hot in summer days; remote — bring supplies.
